00037 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_RPC
00038 
00039 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00040 #include <linux/kernel.h>
00041 #include <obd_class.h>
00042 #include <lustre_net.h>

00048 /*
00049  *  Client's outgoing request callback
00050  */
00051 void request_out_callback(lnet_event_t *ev)
00052 {
00053         struct ptlrpc_cb_id   *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00054         struct ptlrpc_request *req = cbid->cbid_arg;
00055         bool                   wakeup = false;
00056         ENTRY;
00057 
00058         LASSERT(ev->type == LNET_EVENT_SEND || ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK);
00059         LASSERT(ev->unlinked);
00060 
00061         DEBUG_REQ(D_NET, req, "type %d, status %d", ev->type, ev->status);
00062 
00063         sptlrpc_request_out_callback(req);
00064 
00065         spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
00066         req->rq_real_sent = cfs_time_current_sec();
00067         req->rq_req_unlinked = 1;
00068         /* reply_in_callback happened before request_out_callback? */
00069         if (req->rq_reply_unlinked)
00070                 wakeup = true;
00071 
00072         if (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK || ev->status != 0) {
00073                 /* Failed send: make it seem like the reply timed out, just
00074                  * like failing sends in client.c does currently...  */
00075                 req->rq_net_err = 1;
00076                 wakeup = true;
00077         }
00078 
00079         if (wakeup)
00080                 ptlrpc_client_wake_req(req);
00081 
00082         spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
00083 
00084         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00085         EXIT;
00086 }
00087 
00088 /*
00089  * Client's incoming reply callback
00090  */
00091 void reply_in_callback(lnet_event_t *ev)
00092 {
00093         struct ptlrpc_cb_id   *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00094         struct ptlrpc_request *req = cbid->cbid_arg;
00095         ENTRY;
00096 
00097         DEBUG_REQ(D_NET, req, "type %d, status %d", ev->type, ev->status);
00098 
00099         LASSERT (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT || ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK);
00100         LASSERT (ev->md.start == req->rq_repbuf);
00101         LASSERT (ev->offset + ev->mlength <= req->rq_repbuf_len);
00102         /* We've set LNET_MD_MANAGE_REMOTE for all outgoing requests
00103            for adaptive timeouts' early reply. */
00104         LASSERT((ev->md.options & LNET_MD_MANAGE_REMOTE) != 0);
00105 
00106         spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
00107 
00108         req->rq_receiving_reply = 0;
00109         req->rq_early = 0;
00110         if (ev->unlinked)
00111                 req->rq_reply_unlinked = 1;
00112 
00113         if (ev->status)
00114                 goto out_wake;
00115 
00116         if (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK) {
00117                 LASSERT(ev->unlinked);
00118                 DEBUG_REQ(D_NET, req, "unlink");
00119                 goto out_wake;
00120         }
00121 
00122         if (ev->mlength < ev->rlength ) {
00123                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "truncate req %p rpc %d - %d+%d\n", req,
00124                        req->rq_replen, ev->rlength, ev->offset);
00125                 req->rq_reply_truncated = 1;
00126                 req->rq_replied = 1;
00127                 req->rq_status = -EOVERFLOW;
00128                 req->rq_nob_received = ev->rlength + ev->offset;
00129                 goto out_wake;
00130         }
00131 
00132         if ((ev->offset == 0) &&
00133             ((lustre_msghdr_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT))) {
00134                 /* Early reply */
00135                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ADAPTTO, req,
00136                           "Early reply received: mlen=%u offset=%d replen=%d "
00137                           "replied=%d unlinked=%d", ev->mlength, ev->offset,
00138                           req->rq_replen, req->rq_replied, ev->unlinked);
00139 
00140                 req->rq_early_count++; /* number received, client side */
00141 
00142                 /* already got the real reply or buffers are already unlinked */
00143                 if (req->rq_replied ||
00144                     req->rq_reply_unlinked == 1)
00145                         goto out_wake;
00146 
00147                 req->rq_early = 1;
00148                 req->rq_reply_off = ev->offset;
00149                 req->rq_nob_received = ev->mlength;
00150                 /* And we're still receiving */
00151                 req->rq_receiving_reply = 1;
00152         } else {
00153                 /* Real reply */
00154                 req->rq_rep_swab_mask = 0;
00155                 req->rq_replied = 1;
00156                 /* Got reply, no resend required */
00157                 req->rq_resend = 0;
00158                 req->rq_reply_off = ev->offset;
00159                 req->rq_nob_received = ev->mlength;
00160                 /* LNetMDUnlink can't be called under the LNET_LOCK,
00161                    so we must unlink in ptlrpc_unregister_reply */
00162                 DEBUG_REQ(D_INFO, req,
00163                           "reply in flags=%x mlen=%u offset=%d replen=%d",
00164                           lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg),
00165                           ev->mlength, ev->offset, req->rq_replen);
00166         }
00167 
00168         req->rq_import->imp_last_reply_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
00169 
00170 out_wake:
00171         /* NB don't unlock till after wakeup; req can disappear under us
00172          * since we don't have our own ref */
00173         ptlrpc_client_wake_req(req);
00174         spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
00175         EXIT;
00176 }
00177 
00178 /*
00179  * Client's bulk has been written/read
00180  */
00181 void client_bulk_callback (lnet_event_t *ev)
00182 {
00183         struct ptlrpc_cb_id     *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00184         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc = cbid->cbid_arg;
00185         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00186         ENTRY;
00187 
00188         LASSERT((ptlrpc_is_bulk_put_sink(desc->bd_type) &&
00189                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT) ||
00190                 (ptlrpc_is_bulk_get_source(desc->bd_type) &&
00191                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_GET) ||
00192                 ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK);
00193         LASSERT(ev->unlinked);
00194 
00195         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK_ORSET(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_CLIENT_BULK_CB, CFS_FAIL_ONCE))
00196                 ev->status = -EIO;
00197 
00198         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK_ORSET(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_CLIENT_BULK_CB2,CFS_FAIL_ONCE))
00199                 ev->status = -EIO;
00200 
00201         CDEBUG((ev->status == 0) ? D_NET : D_ERROR,
00202                "event type %d, status %d, desc %p\n",
00203                ev->type, ev->status, desc);
00204 
00205         spin_lock(&desc->bd_lock);
00206         req = desc->bd_req;
00207         LASSERT(desc->bd_md_count > 0);
00208         desc->bd_md_count--;
00209 
00210         if (ev->type != LNET_EVENT_UNLINK && ev->status == 0) {
00211                 desc->bd_nob_transferred += ev->mlength;
00212                 desc->bd_sender = ev->sender;
00213         } else {
00214                 /* start reconnect and resend if network error hit */
00215                 spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
00216                 req->rq_net_err = 1;
00217                 spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
00218         }
00219 
00220         if (ev->status != 0)
00221                 desc->bd_failure = 1;
00222 
00223         /* NB don't unlock till after wakeup; desc can disappear under us
00224          * otherwise */
00225         if (desc->bd_md_count == 0)
00226                 ptlrpc_client_wake_req(desc->bd_req);
00227 
00228         spin_unlock(&desc->bd_lock);
00229         EXIT;
00230 }
00231 
00232 /*
00233  * We will have percpt request history list for ptlrpc service in upcoming
00234  * patches because we don't want to be serialized by current per-service
00235  * history operations. So we require history ID can (somehow) show arriving
00236  * order w/o grabbing global lock, and user can sort them in userspace.
00237  *
00238  * This is how we generate history ID for ptlrpc_request:
00239  * ----------------------------------------------------
00240  * |  32 bits  |  16 bits  | (16 - X)bits  |  X bits  |
00241  * ----------------------------------------------------
00242  * |  seconds  | usec / 16 |   sequence    | CPT id   |
00243  * ----------------------------------------------------
00244  *
00245  * it might not be precise but should be good enough.
00246  */
00247 
00248 #define REQS_CPT_BITS(svcpt)    ((svcpt)->scp_service->srv_cpt_bits)
00249 
00250 #define REQS_SEC_SHIFT          32
00251 #define REQS_USEC_SHIFT         16
00252 #define REQS_SEQ_SHIFT(svcpt)   REQS_CPT_BITS(svcpt)
00253 
00254 static void ptlrpc_req_add_history(struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt,
00255                                    struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00256 {
00257         __u64   sec = req->rq_arrival_time.tv_sec;
00258         __u32   usec = req->rq_arrival_time.tv_usec >> 4; /* usec / 16 */
00259         __u64   new_seq;
00260 
00261         /* set sequence ID for request and add it to history list,
00262          * it must be called with hold svcpt::scp_lock */
00263 
00264         new_seq = (sec << REQS_SEC_SHIFT) |
00265                   (usec << REQS_USEC_SHIFT) |
00266                   (svcpt->scp_cpt < 0 ? 0 : svcpt->scp_cpt);
00267 
00268         if (new_seq > svcpt->scp_hist_seq) {
00269                 /* This handles the initial case of scp_hist_seq == 0 or
00270                  * we just jumped into a new time window */
00271                 svcpt->scp_hist_seq = new_seq;
00272         } else {
00273                 LASSERT(REQS_SEQ_SHIFT(svcpt) < REQS_USEC_SHIFT);
00274                 /* NB: increase sequence number in current usec bucket,
00275                  * however, it's possible that we used up all bits for
00276                  * sequence and jumped into the next usec bucket (future time),
00277                  * then we hope there will be less RPCs per bucket at some
00278                  * point, and sequence will catch up again */
00279                 svcpt->scp_hist_seq += (1U << REQS_SEQ_SHIFT(svcpt));
00280                 new_seq = svcpt->scp_hist_seq;
00281         }
00282 
00283         req->rq_history_seq = new_seq;
00284 
00285         list_add_tail(&req->rq_history_list, &svcpt->scp_hist_reqs);
00286 }
00287 
00288 /*
00289  * Server's incoming request callback
00290  */
00291 void request_in_callback(lnet_event_t *ev)
00292 {
00293         struct ptlrpc_cb_id               *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00294         struct ptlrpc_request_buffer_desc *rqbd = cbid->cbid_arg;
00295         struct ptlrpc_service_part        *svcpt = rqbd->rqbd_svcpt;
00296         struct ptlrpc_service             *service = svcpt->scp_service;
00297         struct ptlrpc_request             *req;
00298         ENTRY;
00299 
00300         LASSERT (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT ||
00301                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK);
00302         LASSERT ((char *)ev->md.start >= rqbd->rqbd_buffer);
00303         LASSERT ((char *)ev->md.start + ev->offset + ev->mlength <=
00304                  rqbd->rqbd_buffer + service->srv_buf_size);
00305 
00306         CDEBUG((ev->status == 0) ? D_NET : D_ERROR,
00307                "event type %d, status %d, service %s\n",
00308                ev->type, ev->status, service->srv_name);
00309 
00310         if (ev->unlinked) {
00311                 /* If this is the last request message to fit in the
00312                  * request buffer we can use the request object embedded in
00313                  * rqbd.  Note that if we failed to allocate a request,
00314                  * we'd have to re-post the rqbd, which we can't do in this
00315                  * context. */
00316                 req = &rqbd->rqbd_req;
00317                 memset(req, 0, sizeof (*req));
00318         } else {
00319                 LASSERT (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT);
00320                 if (ev->status != 0) {
00321                         /* We moaned above already... */
00322                         return;
00323                 }
00324                 req = ptlrpc_request_cache_alloc(GFP_ATOMIC);
00325                 if (req == NULL) {
00326                         CERROR("Can't allocate incoming request descriptor: "
00327                                "Dropping %s RPC from %s\n",
00328                                service->srv_name,
00329                                libcfs_id2str(ev->initiator));
00330                         return;
00331                 }
00332         }
00333 
00334         ptlrpc_srv_req_init(req);
00335         /* NB we ABSOLUTELY RELY on req being zeroed, so pointers are NULL,
00336          * flags are reset and scalars are zero.  We only set the message
00337          * size to non-zero if this was a successful receive. */
00338         req->rq_xid = ev->match_bits;
00339         req->rq_reqbuf = ev->md.start + ev->offset;
00340         if (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT && ev->status == 0)
00341                 req->rq_reqdata_len = ev->mlength;
00342         do_gettimeofday(&req->rq_arrival_time);
00343         req->rq_peer = ev->initiator;
00344         req->rq_self = ev->target.nid;
00345         req->rq_rqbd = rqbd;
00346         req->rq_phase = RQ_PHASE_NEW;
00347         if (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT)
00348                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "incoming req@%p x"LPU64" msgsize %u\n",
00349                        req, req->rq_xid, ev->mlength);
00350 
00351         CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "peer: %s\n", libcfs_id2str(req->rq_peer));
00352 
00353         spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00354 
00355         ptlrpc_req_add_history(svcpt, req);
00356 
00357         if (ev->unlinked) {
00358                 svcpt->scp_nrqbds_posted--;
00359                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Buffer complete: %d buffers still posted\n",
00360                        svcpt->scp_nrqbds_posted);
00361 
00362                 /* Normally, don't complain about 0 buffers posted; LNET won't
00363                  * drop incoming reqs since we set the portal lazy */
00364                 if (test_req_buffer_pressure &&
00365                     ev->type != LNET_EVENT_UNLINK &&
00366                     svcpt->scp_nrqbds_posted == 0)
00367                         CWARN("All %s request buffers busy\n",
00368                               service->srv_name);
00369 
00370                 /* req takes over the network's ref on rqbd */
00371         } else {
00372                 /* req takes a ref on rqbd */
00373                 rqbd->rqbd_refcount++;
00374         }
00375 
00376         list_add_tail(&req->rq_list, &svcpt->scp_req_incoming);
00377         svcpt->scp_nreqs_incoming++;
00378 
00379         /* NB everything can disappear under us once the request
00380          * has been queued and we unlock, so do the wake now... */
00381         wake_up(&svcpt->scp_waitq);
00382 
00383         spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00384         EXIT;
00385 }
00386 
00387 /*
00388  *  Server's outgoing reply callback
00389  */
00390 void reply_out_callback(lnet_event_t *ev)
00391 {
00392         struct ptlrpc_cb_id       *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00393         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs = cbid->cbid_arg;
00394         struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt = rs->rs_svcpt;
00395         ENTRY;
00396 
00397         LASSERT (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_SEND ||
00398                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_ACK ||
00399                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK);
00400 
00401         if (!rs->rs_difficult) {
00402                 /* 'Easy' replies have no further processing so I drop the
00403                  * net's ref on 'rs' */
00404                 LASSERT (ev->unlinked);
00405                 ptlrpc_rs_decref(rs);
00406                 EXIT;
00407                 return;
00408         }
00409 
00410         LASSERT (rs->rs_on_net);
00411 
00412         if (ev->unlinked) {
00413                 /* Last network callback. The net's ref on 'rs' stays put
00414                  * until ptlrpc_handle_rs() is done with it */
00415                 spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_rep_lock);
00416                 spin_lock(&rs->rs_lock);
00417 
00418                 rs->rs_on_net = 0;
00419                 if (!rs->rs_no_ack ||
00420                     rs->rs_transno <=
00421                     rs->rs_export->exp_obd->obd_last_committed)
00422                         ptlrpc_schedule_difficult_reply(rs);
00423 
00424                 spin_unlock(&rs->rs_lock);
00425                 spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_rep_lock);
00426         }
00427         EXIT;
00428 }
00429 
00430 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00431 /*
00432  * Server's bulk completion callback
00433  */
00434 void server_bulk_callback (lnet_event_t *ev)
00435 {
00436         struct ptlrpc_cb_id     *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00437         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc = cbid->cbid_arg;
00438         ENTRY;
00439 
00440         LASSERT(ev->type == LNET_EVENT_SEND ||
00441                 ev->type == LNET_EVENT_UNLINK ||
00442                 (ptlrpc_is_bulk_put_source(desc->bd_type) &&
00443                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_ACK) ||
00444                 (ptlrpc_is_bulk_get_sink(desc->bd_type) &&
00445                  ev->type == LNET_EVENT_REPLY));
00446 
00447         CDEBUG((ev->status == 0) ? D_NET : D_ERROR,
00448                "event type %d, status %d, desc %p\n",
00449                ev->type, ev->status, desc);
00450 
00451         spin_lock(&desc->bd_lock);
00452 
00453         LASSERT(desc->bd_md_count > 0);
00454 
00455         if ((ev->type == LNET_EVENT_ACK ||
00456              ev->type == LNET_EVENT_REPLY) &&
00457             ev->status == 0) {
00458                 /* We heard back from the peer, so even if we get this
00459                  * before the SENT event (oh yes we can), we know we
00460                  * read/wrote the peer buffer and how much... */
00461                 desc->bd_nob_transferred += ev->mlength;
00462                 desc->bd_sender = ev->sender;
00463         }
00464 
00465         if (ev->status != 0)
00466                 desc->bd_failure = 1;
00467 
00468         if (ev->unlinked) {
00469                 desc->bd_md_count--;
00470                 /* This is the last callback no matter what... */
00471                 if (desc->bd_md_count == 0)
00472                         wake_up(&desc->bd_waitq);
00473         }
00474 
00475         spin_unlock(&desc->bd_lock);
00476         EXIT;
00477 }
00478 #endif
00479 
00480 static void ptlrpc_master_callback(lnet_event_t *ev)
00481 {
00482         struct ptlrpc_cb_id *cbid = ev->md.user_ptr;
00483         void (*callback)(lnet_event_t *ev) = cbid->cbid_fn;
00484 
00485         /* Honestly, it's best to find out early. */
00486         LASSERT (cbid->cbid_arg != LP_POISON);
00487         LASSERT (callback == request_out_callback ||
00488                  callback == reply_in_callback ||
00489                  callback == client_bulk_callback ||
00490                  callback == request_in_callback ||
00491                  callback == reply_out_callback
00492 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00493                  || callback == server_bulk_callback
00494 #endif
00495                  );
00496 
00497         callback (ev);
00498 }
00499 
00500 int ptlrpc_uuid_to_peer (struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00501                          lnet_process_id_t *peer, lnet_nid_t *self)
00502 {
00503         int               best_dist = 0;
00504         __u32             best_order = 0;
00505         int               count = 0;
00506         int               rc = -ENOENT;
00507         int               dist;
00508         __u32             order;
00509         lnet_nid_t        dst_nid;
00510         lnet_nid_t        src_nid;
00511 
00512         peer->pid = LNET_PID_LUSTRE;
00513 
00514         /* Choose the matching UUID that's closest */
00515         while (lustre_uuid_to_peer(uuid->uuid, &dst_nid, count++) == 0) {
00516                 dist = LNetDist(dst_nid, &src_nid, &order);
00517                 if (dist < 0)
00518                         continue;
00519 
00520                 if (dist == 0) {                /* local! use loopback LND */
00521                         peer->nid = *self = LNET_MKNID(LNET_MKNET(LOLND, 0), 0);
00522                         rc = 0;
00523                         break;
00524                 }
00525 
00526                 if (rc < 0 ||
00527                     dist < best_dist ||
00528                     (dist == best_dist && order < best_order)) {
00529                         best_dist = dist;
00530                         best_order = order;
00531 
00532                         peer->nid = dst_nid;
00533                         *self = src_nid;
00534                         rc = 0;
00535                 }
00536         }
00537 
00538         CDEBUG(D_NET,"%s->%s\n", uuid->uuid, libcfs_id2str(*peer));
00539         return rc;
00540 }
00541 
00542 void ptlrpc_ni_fini(void)
00543 {
00544         wait_queue_head_t         waitq;
00545         struct l_wait_info  lwi;
00546         int                 rc;
00547         int                 retries;
00548 
00549         /* Wait for the event queue to become idle since there may still be
00550          * messages in flight with pending events (i.e. the fire-and-forget
00551          * messages == client requests and "non-difficult" server
00552          * replies */
00553 
00554         for (retries = 0;; retries++) {
00555                 rc = LNetEQFree(ptlrpc_eq_h);
00556                 switch (rc) {
00557                 default:
00558                         LBUG();
00559 
00560                 case 0:
00561                         LNetNIFini();
00562                         return;
00563 
00564                 case -EBUSY:
00565                         if (retries != 0)
00566                                 CWARN("Event queue still busy\n");
00567 
00568                         /* Wait for a bit */
00569                         init_waitqueue_head(&waitq);
00570                         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(cfs_time_seconds(2), NULL, NULL);
00571                         l_wait_event(waitq, 0, &lwi);
00572                         break;
00573                 }
00574         }
00575         /* notreached */
00576 }
00577 
00578 lnet_pid_t ptl_get_pid(void)
00579 {
00580         return LNET_PID_LUSTRE;
00581 }
00582 
00583 int ptlrpc_ni_init(void)
00584 {
00585         int              rc;
00586         lnet_pid_t       pid;
00587 
00588         pid = ptl_get_pid();
00589         CDEBUG(D_NET, "My pid is: %x\n", pid);
00590 
00591         /* We're not passing any limits yet... */
00592         rc = LNetNIInit(pid);
00593         if (rc < 0) {
00594                 CDEBUG (D_NET, "Can't init network interface: %d\n", rc);
00595                 return rc;
00596         }
00597 
00598         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: how we process portals events is _radically_
00599          * different depending on... */
00600         /* kernel LNet calls our master callback when there are new event,
00601          * because we are guaranteed to get every event via callback,
00602          * so we just set EQ size to 0 to avoid overhread of serializing
00603          * enqueue/dequeue operations in LNet. */
00604         rc = LNetEQAlloc(0, ptlrpc_master_callback, &ptlrpc_eq_h);
00605         if (rc == 0)
00606                 return 0;
00607 
00608         CERROR ("Failed to allocate event queue: %d\n", rc);
00609         LNetNIFini();
00610 
00611         return rc;
00612 }
00613 
00614 
00615 int ptlrpc_init_portals(void)
00616 {
00617         int   rc = ptlrpc_ni_init();
00618 
00619         if (rc != 0) {
00620                 CERROR("network initialisation failed\n");
00621                 return rc;
00622         }
00623         rc = ptlrpcd_addref();
00624         if (rc == 0)
00625                 return 0;
00626 
00627         CERROR("rpcd initialisation failed\n");
00628         ptlrpc_ni_fini();
00629         return rc;
00630 }
00631 
00632 void ptlrpc_exit_portals(void)
00633 {
00634         ptlrpcd_decref();
00635         ptlrpc_ni_fini();
00636 }
